casebody.data:
Travis WATSON, Plaintiff-Appellant, v. CIRCUIT COURT, MECKLENBURG COUNTY, Defendant-Appellee. No. 07-6235. United States Court of Appeals, Fourth Circuit. Submitted: April 19, 2007. Decided: April 25, 2007. Travis Watson, Appellant Pro Se. Before NIEMEYER, KING, and GREGORY, Circuit Judges.

Affirmed by unpublished PER CURIAM opinion.

Unpublished opinions are not binding precedent in this circuit.

PER CURIAM:

Travis Watson appeals the district court’s order dismissing his 42 U.S.C. § 1983 (2000) complaint without prejudice. We have reviewed the record and find no reversible error. Accordingly, we affirm for the reasons stated by the district court. Watson v. Circuit Court, No. 2:07-cv-00044-RAJ (E.D.Va. Feb. 5, 2007). We dispense with oral argument because the facts and legal contentions are adequately presented in the materials before the court and argument would not aid the decisional process.

AFFIRMED.
